com.appittome.udacity.client
Class SwipeAdapter

java.lang.Object
  FragmentStatePagerAdapter
      com.appittome.udacity.client.SwipeAdapter

public class SwipeAdapter
extends FragmentStatePagerAdapter

UI object that manages flipping between lists - this is a pager that responds to swipe actions. Each click on a list item in the pager generates the appropriate set of pages for the swipe adapter.

Nested Class Summary
static interface SwipeAdapter.OnListClickListener
          Interface to register for click events on the pager's lists.
static class SwipeAdapter.UdacityListFragment
          ListFragment object to populate for each page of the swipeAdapter.

Super class requires android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager.

Parameters:
fm - FragmentActivity FragmentManager
course_list - the course list representing the state of the graph represented by this UI component.
Method Detail

getCount

public int getCount()
Gets the number of pages currently available. Overriding this method allows this class to vary the number of pages available for swiping based on the current state, which is changed on user picking items from the list.

getItem

public Fragment getItem(int position)
Get the fragment for the current page to be shown.

getItemPosition

public int getItemPosition(java.lang.Object obj)
Implemented to force the rebuilding of all pages on a notifyDataSetChanged event. All that really has to be updated are nodes that are lower than the current in the course graph(pages to the right), but this was quick and easy, and doesn't seem to slow the app down all that much.

addOnListClickListener

true if this listener was not already in the set @see java.util.HashSet

notifyOnListClickListeners

protected static void notifyOnListClickListeners(int i,
                                                 int p)
Notify all listeners of this object that a item in the current listAdapter has been cliked on.

Parameters:
i - index of item clicked within list
p - index of page of item clicked.

getCurrentUnit

public CourseRev.Unit getCurrentUnit()
Returns the current Unit selected by the user as saved in the state of this adapter.

Returns:
current unit selected
